channel.title: Little problem with Run.bat in Server?
channel.description:
Have tried several different codes for my Run.bat and none of them seem to be running the Server? I have set Env Veriables, I have a late version of Java? I just click Run and the Command box just opens and closes within like a split-second? Anyone know what the problem is?
Thanks.

item.title: Little problem with Run.bat in Server?
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“God Of Love, post:3, topic:363324”]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: server at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) Could not find the main class: server. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .

EDIT- Also clients having problems when I use them they close randomly after 5 minutes, will this be with the same problem?

CLIENT MESSAGE:

[code]Opening page:http://www.runewarfare.com

A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:

EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x000000006d847786, pid=2348, t

id=1656

JRE version: 6.0_21-b06

Java VM: Java HotSpot™ 64-Bit Server VM (17.0-b16 mixed mode windows-amd64

)

Problematic frame:

V [jvm.dll+0x57786]

An error report file with more information is saved as:

C:\Users\Mr Penrose\Desktop\The Official Rune-Warfare Client\Rune-Warfare\hs_e

rr_pid2348.log

If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:

http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp

Press any key to continue . . .
[/code][/quote]

The run program cannot locate the server.class byte code, try switching the paths around to make it where you’re server class is. Your other error, try setting your environment variables and download 32BIT JDK.

Read full topic
item.source: Little problem with Run.bat in Server?

item.title: Little problem with Run.bat in Server?
item.dc:creator: @gnomez gnomez
item.description:
@gnomez wrote:

you make one. make a new text document put this in it

http://pastebin.com/zRrYKTnc

(copy and paste it all)

paste it into the text document
then save it as server.java
i hope thats not “advertising” :\

Read full topic

item.title: Little problem with Run.bat in Server?
item.dc:creator: @DuhPk DuhPk
item.description:
@DuhPk wrote:

Edit your run.bat and at the end of the file add
pause
then save and close then try again and post the displayed message here.

Read full topic
